com.roscopeco.ormdroid

Class Query<T extends Entity>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.roscopeco.ormdroid.Query<T>

  • public class Query<T extends Entity>
extends java.lang.Object

    Represents and assists with building a database query that will load an object (or graph). Mostly this class will be used indirectly via the Entity.query(java.lang.Class<T>) method.

    Example usage:

    • MyModel m = Entity.query(MyModel.class).where(eql("id", 1)).execute()
    • MyModel m = Entity.query(MyModel.class).where(eql("name", "Joe")).execute()
    • List l = Entity.query(MyModel.class).where(eql("city", "London")).executeMulti()
    • List l = Entity.query(MyModel.class).executeMulti()
    • MyModel m = Entity.query(MyModel.class).where(and(eql("name", "Joe"), eql("city", "London"))).execute()

      • sql

        public Query<T> sql(java.lang.String sql)
        Set this query to execute the given custom SQL. This SQL must have proper syntax, and will be appended after the "SELECT * FROM sometable " generated by the Query itself. Note that when using this method, you will no longer be able to use the other methods to set query parameters (e.g. where(SQLExpression) and limit(int)).

      • execute

        public T execute()
        Execute the query on the default database, returning only a single result. If the query would return multiple results, only the first will be returned by this method.

      • execute

        public T execute(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db)
        Execute the query on the specified database, returning only a single result. If the query would return multiple results, only the first will be returned by this method.

      • executeMultiForCursor

        public android.database.Cursor executeMultiForCursor()
        Executes the query against the default database, returning a high performance cursor instead of the complete in-memory list of objects.

      • executeMulti

        public java.util.List<T> executeMulti()
        Execute the query on the default database, returning all results.

      • executeMultiForCursor

        public android.database.Cursor executeMultiForCursor(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db)
        Executes the query against the specified database, returning a high performance cursor instead of the complete in-memory list of objects.

        Execute the query on the specified database, returning all results.
